Class Connect4Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Connect4Controller

  • public class Connect4Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Michael Dam, Aaron Valenzuela Takes input from Connect4View GUI and controls a Connect4Model board. The only public methods are: humanTurn() - to be called by View when user clicks on GUI. setupNetwork() - to be called by View when user closes Network dialog box. and some getters so that view can determine when to register clicks from user. When a network is set up, the controller hosting the server will go first as YELLOW. After the host drops the token, the client will go second as RED. Human controllers click on the GUI to drop a token into the board. Computer controllers randomly choose a column to drop a token into. After every turn, checks the board if there is a victory. Closes networks, input, and tells view to open a window when a victory is achieved until a new network is made.

    • Method Detail

      • newGame

        private void newGame()
        Calls the model's initializeBoard() to clear all the slots

      • isHuman

        public boolean isHuman()
        Returns:
        If the user controlling this is human.

      • isMyTurn

        public boolean isMyTurn()
        Returns:
        If it is this controller's turn to drop a token.

      • checkTurn

        private void checkTurn()
        Checks if it is the controller's turn. If it is a computer, calls computerTurn(); Otherwise, waits for GUI to call humanTurn();

      • humanTurn

        public void humanTurn(int col)
        This method is called by the View when a column has been clicked by the user. The controller determines whether the column clicked is full or not and changes the model if is not. If it is, it displays an Error message
        Parameters:
        col - int column index that user clicked on.

      • computerTurn

        private void computerTurn()
        This method should be called when it is this controller's turn and controller is set to Computer

      • theirTurn

        private void theirTurn()
        This method should be called when it is the other controller's turn.

      • checkWinner

        private boolean checkWinner()
        Checks if the model returns victory. Identifies whose victory, then tells view to alert player. Needs to be called when client receives move from other player, and when client does a move.
        Returns:
        true when there is a winner, false when there isn't.

      • setupNetwork

        public void setupNetwork(NetworkSetupDialogBox setup)
        Called by View when the Network Setup dialog box is closed.
        Parameters:
        setup - A custom stage that contains fields for user-given network settings.

      • setupServer

        private void setupServer(NetworkSetupDialogBox setup)
        This method should be called when user wants to set up a server.
        Parameters:
        setup - A custom stage that contains fields for user-given network settings.

      • setupClient

        private void setupClient(NetworkSetupDialogBox setup)
        This method should be called when user wants to set up a client.
        Parameters:
        setup - A custom stage that contains fields for user-given network settings.

      • closeLooseConnections

        private void closeLooseConnections()
        Any connections that the controller has will be closed by this method.
